item.title: Case Update: Samsung Deflects to UPS Despite Undamaged Box
item.description: Day 33 update: Samsung attempting to deflect service-caused damage to UPS shipping claim despite shipping box arriving in perfect condition. Classic blame-shifting tactic documented.
item.content:encoded:
Latest Deflection Tactic Exposed

After 33 days of escalations, Samsung's latest strategy: blame the shipping carrier.

The Problem: The shipping box Samsung sent arrived in perfect condition—no dents, no damage, no crushing. Yet they're escalating a UPS claim for "shipping damage."

The Evidence:

  • Device damage: Bulging adhesive (poor workmanship), frame indentation from repair tools, bezel crack, front screen scratch
  • All damage occurred DURING repair service at Samsung's facility
  • Shipping box arrived undamaged with no external signs of impact

The Tactic: Deflect blame to third-party carrier, hope consumer gives up chasing answers between multiple companies.

This case remains unresolved. BBB and Attorney General complaints remain active.

item.title: Success Story: Consumer Wins $900 Refund via Small Claims Court
item.description: S23 Ultra owner successfully recovered full device value after Samsung's screen repair caused water damage. Samsung settled before court date.
item.content:encoded:
Small Claims Victory Shows Path Forward

After Samsung ignored BBB and Attorney General complaints, one consumer took the next step: small claims court.

The Case:

  • Device: Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra ($900 value)
  • Original Issue: Screen replacement needed
  • Service Result: Device returned with water damage indicators triggered and dead pixels
  • Samsung's Response: Denied responsibility, claimed "customer-induced water damage"

The Resolution:

  • Filed small claims lawsuit for $900 device value + $75 filing fee
  • Samsung's legal team contacted 2 weeks before hearing
  • Offered full settlement: $900 + $125 (filing fees + time)
  • Total Time: 12 weeks from service damage to settlement

Key Takeaway: Samsung settles 85% of small claims cases before court dates. Documentation + willingness to file = results.
